content.description: The first climb you come to on the Endless Wall, this is a right-angling crack that is well-protected.
Start below the overlap, and follow the obvious corner system up to the left. Belay from slightly left of the start if you want to keep eyes on your climber.

The guidebook rates this 5.8, but even with my short time on the rock, I can't bring myself to agree. It's a fun moderate, great if you're looking to learn lead, and the view up top is fantastic. The route starts on a right-trending ramp that you can nearly walk up before getting into some more interesting moves for the grade.

A 70m rope is required.
content.protection: 12 hundred bolts to a couple snazzy anchors.
content.location: This route is a short jaunt after Smarter than the Average Bear and Daydream. Follow the trail down through a million or more aggressive thistles until the rock falls away from you on your left. The first 3 bolts are easily spotted on a very light grade about ten to fifteen feet left of some bushes. You might have trouble seeing the rest of the bolts until you start climbing, but rest assured they're all there, somewhere.

content.description: This has nice movement, but unfortunately it is very dirty with some dubious rock. Climb a small dihedral, then go up the left line of bolts. The right variation into the big dihedral is 5.10.
content.location: It is just right of a wide crack that is just right of a small cave with two hard routes.

content.description: This route gets only one star in the Western Sloper guidebook but climbs a bit better than some other routes with more stores. Clip a low first bolt, and then figure out the bouldery start to the second bolt without many obvious holds. Above, climb thin/crispy edges until reach the final bulge/overlap, and find a way up and left to the anchors.
content.location:
Start right of the corner of

Thunder Buddies

with trees at the base. The trail dips down a little right before this.

content.description: This route will make you roar with happiness. It begins with steep crack/stemming moves to get established in an amazing moderate ramp/dihedral. Recuperate and pull out of the corner through a beautiful juggy roof. It is fun the whole way.
content.location:
It is 100 feet right of

Thunder Buddies

and See Moore Butts.

content.description:
Start to the right of

Roar!!

on a steep and slightly broken face to reach the fun ramp/dihedral. Climb this to the top to reach a lower anchor (5.9+), and then bust out and left through a roof on large holds. The roof may be a bit cryptic for the first attempt, but there are big holds to be found if you search for them. Once you find the beta, this thing is a blast.
Start in a shallow, right-facing corner, climbing up good crimps leading to the anchors.
Follow broken corner systems. This is a great beginner lead.
